it.polimi.se2019.server.graphs

Class Graph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.server.graphs.Graph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of vertex of the graph

    public class Graph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic implementation of a Graph, it's used for distance calculation in the Board.
    Author:
    Andrea Huang

      Constructor used to initialize a blank graph.

      • getAdjacentVertices

        public java.util.List<Vertex<T>> getAdjacentVertices(T content)
        Get all adjacent vertex of a vertex.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isReachable

        public java.lang.Boolean isReachable(T start,
                                     T end,
                                     int maxDistance)
        This method determines if two nodes are reachable in a given amount of steps (maxDistance).
        Parameters:
        start - start is the root node.
        end - end is the final node we are looking for.
        maxDistance - maxDistance is the maximum amount of steps the method will look for the end node.
        Returns:
        false if the end node is not reachable, true otherwise.

      • distance

        public java.lang.Integer distance(T start,
                                  T end)
        This methods computes the distance between two nodes using a breadth-first search. It returns a positive value if the nodes are connected, a negative value (-1) otherwise.
        Parameters:
        start - is the starting node.
        end - is the node we are calculating the distance from start node.
        Returns:
        the distance between the nodes, if the nodes are disconnected it returns -1.
